_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    Atchison County AgChoice - Rock Port

Location:    17287 West Hwy 136, Rock Port, Mo.

Contact:     Alan Lager

Phone:         660-744-6289



1. The Facility Policy



MFA Enterprises, Inc. and the employees of the Atchison County AgChoice - Rock Port are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Atchison County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of bulk dry/liquid fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient.  



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law, and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". 



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and community 

        right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees are not trained to respond to releases of hazardous products but are

           allowed

to shut emergency valves while evacuating if it safe for them to do so.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Periodic evaluations to determine if the facility meets the current ANSI K-61 Code are conducted periodically and updates will be made as time and budgets allow. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.







    3/18/16
